content:
The Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 is amended to include a new section that terminates authority on September 30, 2010. The Livestock Mandatory Reporting Act of 1999 is also amended to extend termination to September 30, 2010. Definitions are updated, including the term "base market hog" as a barrow or gilt with no discounts or premiums added to the base price. The Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 is amended to include new definitions for boars and packers of sows and boars. The term "boar" is defined as a sexually-intact male swine, while packers are now specified as processing plants that meet certain slaughter criteria. SEC. 3. REPORTING; BARROWS AND GILTS.
    Section 232(c) of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 is amended to require daily reporting by packers processing barrows or gilts to the Secretary. The information reported must comply with the publication requirements determined by the Secretary. Packers processing barrows or gilts must comply with publication requirements and provide timely access to information. Reporting deadlines require information on purchased or priced barrows and gilts by 7:00 a.m. and slaughtered ones by 9:00 a.m. Central Time. Information must include all purchase data. The reporting requirements for packers processing barrows and gilts include providing information on purchased or priced animals, slaughter data, base prices, and purchase data. This information must be submitted by specific deadlines to ensure timely access to information. The reporting requirements for packers processing barrows and gilts include details on deductions from the price paid to producers and average net price calculations based on carcass weight. The reporting requirements for packers processing barrows and gilts involve detailing the total amount paid for slaughtered animals, including premiums, discounts, and deductions for balances owed. This information is reported alongside the total carcass weight of the animals. The reporting requirements for packers processing barrows and gilts include disclosing the lowest and highest net prices paid per hundred pounds of carcass weight, along with the average carcass weight of the animals slaughtered. The reporting requirements for packers processing barrows and gilts include disclosing the total carcass weight and number of animals slaughtered during the reporting period. Adjusted for special slaughter situations, the Secretary determines necessary to render comparable carcass weights, including the average sort loss and average backfat thickness measured between the third and fourth from the last ribs. The average lean percentage of carcass weight for barrows and gilts slaughtered during the reporting period must be reported, along with supporting data and methodology. The Secretary may convert the average lean percentage to correlate to a common percent lean measurement for barrows and gilts slaughtered, including packer-owned swine, and report the total slaughter quantity as the total number of barrows and gilts slaughtered during the reporting period. The Secretary shall publish packer purchase commitments for barrows and gilts scheduled for slaughter in the next 14 days in a prior day report by 8:00 a.m. Central Time. The Secretary publishes price distributions of net prices for barrows and gilts received from packers, including the lowest and highest prices reported. Packer processing plants must report this information to the Secretary for publication. Packer processing plants must report the total number of barrows and gilts purchased, base prices paid, and other relevant details to the Secretary by 10:00 a.m. Central Time each reporting day. The Secretary requires packer processing plants to report the total number of barrows and gilts purchased by 10:00 a.m. Central Time each reporting day. Additionally, corporate officers or designated representatives must report the packer's best estimate of barrows and gilts by 2:00 p.m. Central Time. The Secretary will publish this information in the morning report by 11:00 a.m. Central Time. The Secretary requires packer processing plants to report the total number of barrows and gilts purchased by 10:00 a.m. Central Time each reporting day. This includes information on base prices paid for market hogs through different types of purchases. The Secretary will publish this information in the morning report by 11:00 a.m. Central Time. SEC. 4. REPORTING; SOWS AND BOARS.
    Section 232 of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 
1635j) is amended to include daily reporting requirements for packers of sows and boars. Packer officers must report necessary information to the Secretary for publication in the afternoon report by 3:00 p.m. Central Time each reporting day. Packer must comply with publication requirements and provide timely access to information for producers, packers, and market participants. Reporting on sows and boars purchased or priced must be done by 9:30 a.m. Central Time each reporting day, including purchase data divided into weight classes specified by the Secretary. The Secretary requires packers to report various information on sows and boars purchased, including average prices, number of animals in weight classes, and other relevant data. The Secretary requires packers to report information on sows and boars purchased, including prices and other relevant data. Packers must exclude prices of packer-owned swine from calculations and reports. Public auction purchases by packer agents are exempt from reporting requirements. The information obtained must be published in a prior day report by 11:00 a.m. Central Time. The Secretary of Agriculture mandates electronic submission of required information on sows and boars purchased from packers by 11:00 a.m. Central Time on the reporting day.
